meanings.sent1: She tends to overlade her backpack with too many books for school.
meanings.sent2: The movers had to be careful not to overlade the truck with too much furniture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit all those toys in one box will surely overlade it!
meanings.sent4: The weight of his guilt seemed to overlade his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the tree were overladed with ripe fruit, ready to fall.

meanings.definition: To overburden or overwhelm with work or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: The boss tends to overlade his employees with too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent2: She felt overladed with responsibilities after taking on the new project.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to overlade you with all these chores, I just lost track of time!
meanings.sent4: The news of the impending deadline overladed him with stress.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overladed the students with homework over the weekend.
